Surfin' Safari (Brian Wilson/Mike Love)

E.....................................D.............................................B7..................................E.......E7
Let's go surfing now, everybody's learning how, come on a safari with me.

A...................................................D.............................E7.....................................A
Early in the morning we'll be starting out, some honeys will be coming along
.............A.......................................................D.............................E7.......................................A
We're loading up our woody with the boards in-side and heading out singing our song.

A
Come on baby, wait and see, yes, I'm gonna take you surfing with me
D...........................................................A
Lonesome baby wait and see, yes, I'm gonna take you surfing with me
E......................................D.............................................B7.................................E........E7
Let's go surfing now, everybody's learning how, come on a safari with me

........A........................................................D..............................E7............................................A
In Huntington and Malibu they're shooting the pier, in Rincon, they're walking the nose
..............A..................................D...................................................E7.............................A
We're going on safari to the islands this year so if you're coming, get ready to go

.................A.......................................D.............................E7...................................A
They're angling in Laguna and Cerro Azul, they're kicking out in Doheny too
....................A.......................................................D......................................E7......................................A
I tell you surfing's running wild, it's getting bigger every day from Hawaii to the shores of Peru

We're going surfin', surfin', surfin', surfin', surfin', surfin', surfin', surfin'

Yeah my surfer knots are rising and my board is losing wax

Heads You Win, Tails I Lose (Brian Wilson/Gary Usher)


A...................G..........................F.....................E
Every time, we have a fight, we flip a coin to see who's right

...........A................................................F#m
Why do we have to gamble just to see who's right?
.............A...............................F#m
Why can't we arbitrarily resolve a fight?
..........D....................................................................E
But with you're style of gamblin' there's no chance to win
..............D.....................................................E
That's how it is, and that's the way it's always been

F#m.......................E.................F#m.....................E............................A
Heads you win, tails I lose, heads, you win, tails, I lose, bad news

....A............................................................F#m
If we were playing cards you'd be the one to deal
.............A......................................................F#m
You'd play with loaded dice and fix the roulette wheel
..........D...............................................E
You pick 'em at the races like I've never seen
...........D.......................................................E
And then you make me pay off like a slot machine

....................D
Oh well, match me honey (match me honey)
A
Take my money (take my money)
.............................................D..................................B7..........E
You know the odds are yours (flip it baby), so flip the coin

.........A............................................................F#m
I'm gonna make some changes with this gamblin' game
............A...............................................F#m
From now on I'm the dealer and I'll do the same
.......D.............................................................E
I'll load my dice and stack the deck and fix the odds again
......D......................................................E
So if you want to flip to see who's right I know I'll win

Summertime Blues (E. Cochran / J. Capehart)

.........E......................................................................E...A...B...E
I'm gonna raise a fuss, I'm gonna raise a holler
....................E.........................................................................E...A...B...E
About a workin' all summer just to try to earn a dollar
............A
Every time I call my baby, and ask to get a date
.........E
My boss says, "No dice son, you gotta work late"
A
Sometimes I wonder what I'm a gonna do
...................E.................................................................E...A...B...E
But there ain't no cure for the summertime blues

..................E....................................................................................................E...A...B...E
Well my mom and pop told me, "Son you gotta make some money"
...............E.......................................................................E...A...B...E
If you want to use the car to go ridin' next Sunday
..............A
Well I didn't go to work, told the boss I was sick
.....................E

A
Sometimes I wonder what I'm a gonna do
...................E................................................................E...A...B...E
But there ain't no cure for the summertime blues

I'm gonna take two weeks, gonna have a fine vacation

Cuckoo Clock (Brian Wilson/Gary Usher)


(original key: F#)


F.........................................................Dm
We knew it must have been late, we had no time to wait
Bb............................................C7
I went to light the fireplace, I planned it all this way, and
F.........................................Dm
I snuggled close to her, her heart began to purr
Bb.....................................................C7
I held my breath inside, and then I put my arms around her

Bb.....................................................F.............................................................Bb
Cuckoo, cuckoo (go away silly bird), cuckoo, cuckoo (go away silly bird)
........................................................C7
Cuckoo, cuckoo (go away silly bird), cuckoo, cuckoo

F......................................Dm
I put that birdie away, his cuckoo was gone to stay
Bb...........................................C7
We both apologized so I, forgave that doggone cuckoo
F.......................................Dm
I went back to her side, I had to swallow my pride
Bb..................................................C7
The fire had almost died away, we just got situated

F......................................Dm
I took that clock apart, I broke the cuckoo's heart
Bb.............................................C7
He'll never bother us again, we just forgot about him

Student Demonstration Time


Based on "Riot in Cell Block Number 9" by Jerry Leiber & Mike Stoller
New lyrics by Mike Love


................A
Starting out with Berkeley Free Speech and later on at People's Park
The winds of change fanned into flames student demonstrations spark
Down to Isla Vista where police felt so harassed
They called the special riot squad of the L. A. County Sheriff

..........................D....................................A
Well there's a riot going on, there's a riot going on
..................E........................D.................................A........E
There's a riot going on, student demonstration time

A
The violence spread down South to where Jackson State brothers
Learned not to say nasty things about Southern policemen's mothers
Nothing much was said about it and really next to nothing done
The pen is mightier than the sword, but no match for a gun

..........................D....................................A
Well there's a riot going on, there's a riot going on
..........................E.....................D.....................................................A..E
Well there's a riot going on 'cause it's student demonstration time

A
America was stunned on May 4, 1970
When rally turned to riot up at Kent State University
They said the students scared the Guard though the troops were battle dressed
Four martyrs earned a new degree - The Bachelor of Bullets
I know we're all fed up with useless wars and racial strife
But next time there's a riot, well, you best stay out of sight

..........................D....................................A
Well there's a riot going on, there's a riot going on
..........................E.......................D..................................A.......E
Well there's a riot going on, student demonstration time

California Saga/The Beaks of Eagles (Robinson Jeffers, Alan Jardine, Lynda Jardine)


Cm
An eagle's nest on the head of an old redwood
On one of the precipice-footed ridges above Ventana Creek
That jagged country which nothing but a fallen meteor will ever plow
No horseman will ever ride there, no hunter cross this ridge but the winged ones
No-one will steal the eggs from this fortress
.......Cm/Bb
The she-eagle is old, her mate was shot long ago
Cm/Ab
She is now mated with a son of hers.
............G7
When lightning blasted her nest she built it again on the same tree in the splinters of the thunder bolt.

..........C.........Dm7........C/E.........................F...............C/G....F....C/E....Dm7
In a broken shack an old man takes his time about dyin'
..........C..............Dm7.....C/E..............F...................G7
And just at the back a wild flowerbed that he'll lie in
........F...............C/E......Dm7............C/E
In dawn's new light a man might venture
......C..................Dm7..........C/E.........F....C/G....F....C/E....Dm7....Cm
A horse drawn stage from Monterey

Cm
The she-eagle is older than I, she was here when the fires of eighty-five raged on these ridges
She was lately fledged and dared not hunt ahead of them but ate scorched meat.
The world has changed in her time
Cm/Bb
Humanity has multiplied, but not here;
..............................Cm/Ab
Men's hopes and thoughts and customs have changed, their powers are enlarged
...........G7
Their powers and their follies have become fantastic.

...C........................Dm7....C/E...................F................C/G......F....C/E....Dm7
Spilled down the hill a wagon load of bodies lay scattered,
....C....................Dm7..C/E..........F....................G7
Shipwrecked at sea, limestone ore is all that mattered.
...........F........................C/E.........Dm7................................C/E
They took it from the hills right in through the cargo doors
..........C...................................Dm7.......................C/E...........................F..C/G..F..C/E..Dm7..Cm
And how many ships have come and gone at Thurso's landing shore?


Cm
The unstable animal never has been changed so rapidly
The motor and the plane and the great war have gone over him
And Lenin has lived and Jehovah died while the mother-eagle hunts the same hills
Crying the same beautiful and lonely cry
......................Cm/Bb
And is never tired, dreams the same dreams
.....................................Cm/Ab
And hears at night the rock-slides rattle and thunder in the throats of these living mountains
........Cm
It is good for man to try all changes
.........................................................Cm/Bb
Progress and corruption, powers, peace and anguish, not to go down the dinosaur's way
.........Cm/Ab
Until all his capacities have been explored
And it is good for him to know that his needs and nature
.......G7
Are no more changed, in fact, In ten thousand years than the beaks of eagles.

...............C.......Dm7.........C/E.............................F....................C/G....F....C/E....Dm7
Of the eagle's plight, we know that nature's balance is undone.
......................C..................Dm7......C/E...........F......................G7
And it's the birthright of man to unify and live his life as one.
.........F...................C/E......................Dm7.....................C
A whisper of the word will let you soar with your soul.

Christmas Day
